text: A corny throwback to Arnold glory days as an action star with a below average cast that can't make this mediocre story any better than it was actually written.
Fun but could use more focus on Arnold.

The Last Stand is on par with Arnold's other films, and I loved it!  As with all his action based movies, no one cares about the plot. We're just there for action.  I will say, I was pleasantly surprised by the faces that showed up, including the sexy Jaime Alexander.  Loved the cast and loved the action.
Enjoyable action movie to pass the time.

It's a good and pretty simple action movie, not too over the top and not trash, I'd recommend watching to see what you'd think about it, but me? I love it, It's what most movies need nowadays, not an extremely complicated storyline that can be easily messed up and not a boring one, also Arnold's acting was also great as usual.
It’s a great film, Arnie is excellent , it’s your classic underdog takes on the bad guy flick .
I’ve now seen this film 4 times over the years , it’s a simple action flick , nothing more , nothing less …… I gave it 4 stars because I like simple action flicks .

I recently watched a classic action movie featuring Arnold Schwarzenegger. It had everything you'd expect from an old-school action flick - epic shootouts, powerful guns, and speedy cars. The storyline was more interesting than your typical action movie, not overly profound but creatively executed. The usual villains attempted to flee using helicopters or planes, but this time they were chased down in a souped-up Corvette Z1. If you enjoy traditional action movies, I highly recommend giving this one a watch.

The Last Stand" presents a mix of action and humor, with Arnold Schwarzenegger in the lead. While the film delivers on the expected adrenaline-pumping sequences and showcases Schwarzenegger's enduring charisma, it falls short of leaving a lasting impression. The plot feels somewhat formulaic, and the characters lack the depth needed to fully engage the audience. Despite my meh rating, fans of classic Schwarzenegger action may find it worth a watch for the nostalgic elements, but overall, "The Last Stand" doesn't quite reach the heights of other action films in the genre.
Knoxville is too annoying to watch.

8/10 - A very kick ass action comedy film, Arnie is back.

The film is a bit slow at the start but during the beginning some characters are introduced and the early scenes provide a bit of mystery about what the bad guys are trying to achieve which can be fun to figure out. As soon as the main bad guy is introduced the action pretty much does not stop. And we are shown a wide range of car chases and shoot ups that are very intense. But in between these shoot 'em up and car chase scenes there is some dialogue which does build up characters but also can be a little boring.

The last act of the film is also very action packed and full of gun fights that involve all kinds of weapons from shot guns to pistols to a kick ass chain gun. There is also some comedy in these action scenes and this is sometimes funny but some of the jokes make it seem a bit less intense. 

The last fight between Arnold Schwarzenegger and the main bad guy also involves a good car chase and some great hand to hand combat which finishes the film off very nicely. And makes you realise that Arnold Schwarzenegger is still a good actor and this is probably one of the best films he has been the main character in since Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines.
Another great Arnie action film with great comic relief
Tired of Arnold's trying hard humor.
This movie was great! A must-see action pack, older loved Arnold is here to stay. The comedic releases adds to the suspense. Don't let the boring critics sway you away from a fun film!
Underrated and pretty awesome latter Arnie action movie, lots of action and the comedic properties aren't gimmicky.

Filme que tinha tudo para ser o "filme" , mas o povo de hollywood insiste em misturar ação com comédia , sempre repetindo a mesma piada "você está velho para isso" em referencia ao personagem que está aposentando transcendo ao ator que também está velho para ser ator (Arnold).  Mas é um bom filme para fugir da realidade.
Not even sure if this is worth watching on Netflix. It was just meh.
I like how it switch bck & forth frm to story lines then merges them. Arnold HITS the mark again!

It's a fun movie.  Don't expect 'Terminator' or 'Predator'.  This movie doesn't take itself too seriously.  It reminds me of an old western, back when the sheriff couldn't be bought and wouldn't back down.  You know how things are going to turn out and the movie doesn't disappoint.
It was funny and a good way to pass the time. The criminal in the story was on a personal ego trip the entire time but the rest was good.
